author: Amazon Customer
product_name: Mp3 Player, Bluetooth 5.0Mp3 Player, FM Radio, 8GB Mp3 Player, Walking Step-by-Step Portable Music Player, Recorder, e-Book Video Support up to 128GB

review:
I've owned a few mp3 players over the years. I've had this player for two days and tested its capabilities.
Cons:
- No matter what headphones I use, I lose the Bluetooth connection as soon as I turn a corner. I bought this especially for the Bluetooth feature so that was a surprise.
- It has an awkward, unintuitive interface. Navigation isn't easy. The font used makes the player appear really cheap.
- The player could not count past 4,000 songs from my memory card. However, it appears to accurately count everything below 4,000.
- No lock button/feature. However, when the screen turns off, the navigation buttons don't work but the volume buttons still work.
- There's no way to find a song/artist/album quickly.
- I couldn't find any EQ feature/functionality.
- It does not allow viewing of photos while playing music simultaneously.
- Shuffle play repeats songs before playing every song. A bit annoying.
Pros:
- Solid metal casing. The little player doesn't feel like it's going to fall apart. There's definitely a reassuring heft to it.
- After at least 2 - 3 hours of using Bluetooth, the battery indicator showed full.
- The sound was surprisingly good, perhaps better than my 6-month-old smartphone.
- It accepted my 32GB memory card and read the contents in only 2 - 3 minutes (too bad it can't count past 4,000).
- While music plays, album art is shown in low def. Song information (artist, title, album) scrolls slowly by.
- The tiny speaker works. It doesn't sound great but the volume can be increased, accordingly. Not great for music but may be good for audiobooks.

I tried not to compare it to any of my previous and current players (ranging from an old USB-style player to a high-end player). I wanted an inexpensive Bluetooth player for my commute which would save my phone's battery. I wasn't expecting a high-def sound or a great interface. Unfortunately, there were too many unpleasant surprises (Bluetooth connectivity chief among them) to outweigh the pleasant surprises such as the better than expected sound. I didn't want to spend more money but it looks like I'll have to do so. I returned this player and will be spending more money on another Bluetooth player on amazon that supposedly has better Bluetooth connectivity.
author: Burnaby Customer
product_name: Mp3 Player, Bluetooth 5.0Mp3 Player, FM Radio, 8GB Mp3 Player, Walking Step-by-Step Portable Music Player, Recorder, e-Book Video Support up to 128GB

review: liked the reasonable the price and long battery life. Dislikes the Bluetooth. Haven't managed to connect to any PC or laptop at home (windows 10). Ultra-sensitive touch screen - you put it in your shirt pocket and it stops playing or switches the selection. No lock button. The internal speakers are awful, as the accompanying headset. The user interface is not great, and the font is bad.
author: verified customer
product_name: Mp3 Player, Bluetooth 5.0Mp3 Player, FM Radio, 8GB Mp3 Player, Walking Step-by-Step Portable Music Player, Recorder, e-Book Video Support up to 128GB

review: I was looking for something to replace my Sony Walkman MP3 player, without paying $200. I love this one. It;s easy to use, you can up the capacity, it reads all sorts of music formats, videos and even ebooks. It is good looking, user friendly and I am totally satisfied with my purchase. Earphones are so-so, but I wanted it to hook up to my sound bar. We have music in the house again!
author: Kindle Customer
product_name: Mp3 Player, Bluetooth 5.0Mp3 Player, FM Radio, 8GB Mp3 Player, Walking Step-by-Step Portable Music Player, Recorder, e-Book Video Support up to 128GB

review: I didn't like the shipping I guess. It had a weird blue hue on the screen and when you turn it, to we if it's a glare or not, it was a scratch. Now I know why I can't see anything on the screen. I got music on there, but have no clue what's going on. I didn't even know I could read anything on the screen until I came back on here to figure out what I'm doing wrong. So yeah, I guess it's a cool doo hivkey, just change your handling and shipping. Maybe better packaging ? I don't know, I know I prob won't bother again.

author: Carole loyer
product_name: Mp3 Player, Bluetooth 5.0Mp3 Player, FM Radio, 8GB Mp3 Player, Walking Step-by-Step Portable Music Player, Recorder, e-Book Video Support up to 128GB

review:
We ride a motorcycle and use a Bluetooth Intercom system to talk to each other. My wife love's to listen to her music while we ride through the headset and this Mp3 player works perfectly.

The Mp3 is made of metal and not plastic so it is very solid. The screen is bright and easy to read.

One feature it does lack is the ability to resume where it left off after you turn it off so it starts at the beginning. Your other option is to select shuffle.

She also loves that it has a spot to attach a lanyard so if she has it out and is adjusting the controls while we are moving she knows she won't loose it if it slips of her hands. It didn't come with the lanyard but we had a couple kicking around so just used it.

I purchased the unit in January but didn't start using it until sometime in May when we were out riding. A few days ago my wife went to turn it on ant the power button pushed in and stayed there (it should have popped back out). I contacted the seller, explained what happened and sent a couple of pictures. The seller contacted me immediately and sent out a replacement.
author: Dan Westlake
product_name: Mp3 Player, Bluetooth 5.0Mp3 Player, FM Radio, 8GB Mp3 Player, Walking Step-by-Step Portable Music Player, Recorder, e-Book Video Support up to 128GB

review: I have had a number of Bluetooth players over the years but this particular unit Is the only one that causes music to distort and cuts out when moved even when close to the receiving speaker. I bought this as a replacement for 2 Agptek units I had that worked fine but their interface was too small for me to see. When you move around with this unit in your hand, the music cuts off even when there is no obstruction between the unit and the receiver. When someone walks between the device and the speaker, the music will distort. Not sure if it is defective or the nature of the beast but I am not impressed. Not sure if I will return it at this point or just live with the issues. Based on this I cannot recommend.
author: Norbert Hibbeln
product_name: Mp3 Player, Bluetooth 5.0Mp3 Player, FM Radio, 8GB Mp3 Player, Walking Step-by-Step Portable Music Player, Recorder, e-Book Video Support up to 128GB

review: Was just about exactly what I was looking for. My only complaint, you must use wired ear buds in order to use the FM. The wire works as the antenna. I didn‚Äôt see where it said that on the spec sheet when I was buying it. I assumed it was bluetooth and that‚Äôs why I purchased it, but it still a good little unit and I‚Äôm happy I got it. That‚Äôs why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5
